title: [FR] Add Python fluent API for search_registered_models

labels.name: area/model-registry
labels.description: Model registry, model registry APIs, and the fluent client calls for model registry

labels.name: has-closing-pr
labels.description: This issue has a closing PR

body:
### Willingness to contribute

No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

### Proposal Summary

Introduce a Python API for search_registered_models:

```
mlflow.search_registered_models(filter_string: Optional[str] = None, max_results: int = 100, order_by: Optional[List[str]] = None)
```

### Motivation

> #### What is the use case for this feature?

Help users easily search registered models without having to handle pagination

> #### Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general? ^ 

> #### Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization? ^ 

> #### Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case? Users must rely on the https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/python_api/mlflow.client.html#mlflow.client.MlflowClient.search_registered_models API, which requires them to handle page tokens manually


### Details

The API should be implemented in https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/7f2152370b8e93ed7bf8cc3e5e1e7ff39cd69ca5/mlflow/tracking/fluent.py

The only difference between this API and https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/python_api/mlflow.client.html#mlflow.client.MlflowClient.search_registered_models is that it should automatically handle pagination: instead of including a `page_token` argument, the API should 1. call https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/python_api/mlflow.client.html#mlflow.client.MlflowClient.search_registered_models, 2. retrieve the page token from the PagedList, 3. Call https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/python_api/mlflow.client.html#mlflow.client.MlflowClient.search_registered_models with the page token and append the results to the previous PagedList, 4. Continue until https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/python_api/mlflow.client.html#mlflow.client.MlflowClient.search_registered_models no longer returns a page token.

For reference, see https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/7f2152370b8e93ed7bf8cc3e5e1e7ff39cd69ca5/mlflow/tracking/fluent.py#L1154-L1167. MLflow provides a utility to help with pagination: https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/7f2152370b8e93ed7bf8cc3e5e1e7ff39cd69ca5/mlflow/utils/__init__.py#L224.

We can add some simple tests to https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/tests/tracking/fluent/test_fluent.py.

### What component(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
- [ ] `area/examples`: Example code
- [X] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry
- [ ] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors
- [ ] `area/recipes`: Recipes, Recipe APIs, Recipe configs, Recipe Templates
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/scoring`: MLflow Model server, model deployment tools, Spark UDFs
- [ ] `area/server-infra`: MLflow Tracking server backend
- [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

### What interface(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server
- [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support

### What language(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/new`: Proposals for new client languages

### What integration(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
- [ ] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations
- [ ] `integrations/databricks`: Databricks integrations
